1. Ovidiu Diaconescu, Charging Real $Money$ Every Month 

- How to be fully PCI DSS 3 compliant with Braintree Payments gateway. 

- Azure AspNetCore App that processes Credit Cards and Paypal 

- WebHooks for monthly validations.

2. Andrei Rinea, ASP.NET Core on OS X and Linux using an IDE

During this talk we will have a short introduction to developing and running ASP.NET Core on OS X and Linux using an IDE. ASP.NET Core not only runs on other OSs but productive development can now be achieved on these. Together with the participants we will walk through the main steps of creating and running a web application.

1. Hosting Web Applications in the Azure App Service - deployment, scaling, monitoring, and more 

Prezentator: Julian Atanasoae, Azure App Service Support Engineer @ Microsoft

Descriere:

Build web apps that scale Code in your favorite language and IDE – .NET, NodeJS, PHP, Python, or Java – to build web apps and APIs faster than ever. Be more agile with continuous integration using Visual Studio Team Services or GitHub and with live-site debugging. Easily scale applications on-demand with high availability.

2. Audit/History in EF / Sql Server
Prezentator: Andrei Ignat, http://serviciipeweb.ro/iafblog/
Descriere:
Vom prezenta cum se poate obtine o tabela de istoric in SQL Server. Vom incepe cu ADO.NET, vom trece la EF, apoi trigger pe tabele si , in sfirsit, cele 2 solutii SQL Server: Change Data Capture si Temporal Tables

meetup-Bucharest-Deep-Learning-235752975.description:
This talk will discuss the problem of using the game of StarCraft (and its successor StarCraft II) as a research environment for AI. The presentation will consist of two main parts:

• Discussion of the recent work done by Facebook AI Research on StarCraft micromanagement tasks [1] and the soon to be released TorchCraft library [2].

• Keynote on StarCraft as a testbed for general artificial intelligence, in which I will address the numerous challenges posed by this game, from the perspective of an AI researcher and former professional StarCraft player.



Main Reading Materials:

• [1] Episodic Exploration for Deep Deterministic Policies for StarCraft Micromanagement - https://openreview.net/forum?id=r1LXit5ee

Additional Reading Materials:

• [2] TorchCraft: a Library for Machine Learning Research on Real-Time Strategy Games (white paper) - https://arxiv.org/abs/1611.00625


• [3] A Survey of Real-Time Strategy Game AI Research and Competition in StarCraft - https://hal.inria.fr/file/index/docid/871001/filename/survey.pdf

Speaker: Ionel Hosu
meetup-Bucharest-Deep-Learning-235752975.title: Learning to play StarCraft, the next step towards AGI
meetup-Bucharest-Deep-Learning-235752975.venue: TechHub Bucharest: District 2, 39-41 Strada Nicolae Filipescu, Bucharest

meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.description:
Programul intalnirii:
6:30-7:00 sosirea participantilor + pizza din partea Ullink
7:00 - 8:00 - Mihai Andrei - Imutabilitatea din perspectiva programarii stiintifice

Mihai are in spate o experienta mixta de proiecte de cercetare si comerciale. In ultima vreme a dezvoltat simulari numerice pentru neuroscience. A folosit si apreciaza limbajele functionale dar considera ca limbaje cum ar fi C sau Prolog isi au locul lor.

Prezentarea isi propune sa discute ideea de imutabilitate atat in mediul ei natural, programarea functionala, cat si departe de el in limbaje foarte mutabile cum ar fi C. Problema performantei va fi adresata discutand despre structuri de date persistente.

Programarea cu valori imutabile generaza programe mai simple. Multe stari invalide devin imposibile. Multe proceduri devin functii pure. In programarea functionala valorile imutabile sunt esentiale, fac parte din definitia termenului.

Mutabilele isi au rolul lor insa starile se schimba in timp iar unele manipulari low level de structuri sunt obligatoriu mutabile.

Singurul dezavantaj major al imutabilelor, performanta, este ameliorata de structuri de date speciale. Numite "persistent data structures" acestea permit copierea ieftina a unei valori. Vom exemplifica implementarea unor asemenea structuri.
meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.title: Imutabilitatea din perspectiva programarii stiintifice
meetup-Cluj-fp-235150131.venue: Sediul Ullink: Str Victor Deleu nr 1, et 3 (intrarea dinspre Parcul Caragiale), cluj-napoca

meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.description:
Programul intalnirii:
6:30-7:00 sosirea participantilor + pizza din partea Ullink
7:00 - 8:30 - Lőrinc Pap - Creating an effective persistent ArrayList alternative

Globally propagating mutations hinder us from being able to reason about an application with only minimal knowledge of its surroundings, from stepping back in a debugger and replaying the whole sequence of operations, from creating simple performance benchmarks or tests, without being concerned with the overall state of the application at all times.

Let’s see how we could design for correcting many of these issues, by creating a data structure that has the same (or better!) space/time complexities than Java’s beloved ArrayList does, and by providing a real-world example where it would shine with its simplicity.

We will explore some of the design compromises we took when creating Javaslang’s persistent Radix-Balanced Vector tree, and compare it to Scala and Clojure – feature and performance-wise.
meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.title: Creating an effective persistent ArrayList alternative
meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.venue: Sediul Ullink: Str Victor Deleu nr 1, et 3 (intrarea dinspre Parcul Caragiale), cluj-napoca

meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.description:
În luna Decembrie, ITCamp organizează un nou eveniment pentru profesioniștii IT din Cluj-Napoca. Evenimentul urmează să aibă loc pe data de 07 Decembrie, la sediul Endava (United Business Center, lângă Iulius Mall). Participarea la eveniment este gratuită. Mulțumim Endava pentru găzduire.

Event page: http://itcamp-community-2016-12.eventbrite.com


Program:

17:45 – 18:15 – Welcoming & Registration 

18:15 – 19:00 – Systems Development in a Changing World – Eoin Woods

19:00 – 19:15 – Coffe Break

19:15 – 20:00 – Empower your Raspberry PI using Azure IoT Suite – Radu Vunvulea

20:00 – 21:00 – Augmented Reality in Industrial Predictive Maintenance, including HoloLens – Tibor Molnar

21:00 – 22:00 – Networking


Descrierea sesiunilor:

- Systems Development in a Changing World (Eoin Woods): The way we build systems is changing. From our history of monolithic systems, then distributed systems, to Internet connected systems, we are now entering the era of cloud-hosted, microservice based, pay-for-usage system development. What does the history of software development tell us about the challenges of this new environment? And how does our approach to building systems need to evolve in order to meet them?

- Empower your Raspberry PI using Azure IoT Suite (Radu Vunvulea): What can you do with smart devices nowadays? In the next 45 minutes we will take a look on what we can do With Raspberry PI and how this device can become the brain of an intelligent house or office. The session will contain a lot of demos explaining what we can do to empower this smart device with the IoT Intelligence on top of Azure. We will also use NodeJs and C++ beside C# code.

- Augmented Reality in Industrial Predictive Maintenance, including HoloLens (Tibor Molnar): Industry 4.0 comes with interconnected machines using IoT, cloud computing and machine learning (beside many other things). We at iQuest are working on an end to end IoT solution architecture which includes gateways for devices, IoT hubs, maintenance case predictions, real time business intelligence and augmented reality support for devices maintenance and predictive maintenance. Additionally, we are testing Augmented Reality to provide a better experience and support for field engineers doing devices maintenance work. This session will present high level an example IoT architecture, then will focus on details regarding how to implement holographic and object augmentation experiences in devices maintenance using Microsoft Hololens, Unity, Visual Studio and the PTC Vuforia platform.

Sponsor: Endava
meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.title: Winter ITCamp Community Event
meetup-ITCamp-Community-235877883.venue: Endava, United Business Center: Al. Vaida Voievod nr. 51, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Product-Camp-Bucharest-Meetup-235.description:
Hi Product Campers,

Our next meetup is about “Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

"What are the consequences of not having mentioned the unilateral termination of a service contract?

What options do you have if the client is not paying you?

What are the hidden risks to consider when the lease agreement on your office headquarters is close to expiration?

This workshop, built upon my years of experience in working with both young and experienced entrepreneurs, aims to provide insight into how even the simplest contractual clauses can hide unfortunate consequences that can lead anywhere from loss of profit to loss or reputation or even bankruptcy.

Understanding such issues can help you make an informed decision and mitigate risks or even avoid them altogether."

In the second part we have Open Space and we invite you to come up with your topic or question related to Product Development, Software Product Management, or anything related to our theme.

Agenda:

18:45 - 19:00 Welcome Product Campers

19:00 - 20:00 "Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

20:00 - 20:10 BREAK

20:10 - 21:15 Open Space

See you at Tech Hub Bucharest on Monday, 23rd January 2017!
meetup-Product-Camp-Bucharest-Meetup-235.title: Product Camp Bucharest #9 - "Contractual Risks in Early Stage Business"

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Cluj-dvppbkyvqb.description:
Salut!

Pentru urmatorul meetup, va propunem o sesiune cu accent pe comunicare. Alexandru Moldovan e un specialist in educatie experientiala si un trainer cu o experinta foarte vasta in cadrul mai multor organizatii si companii. A fost presedinte al organizatiei Cercetasii Romaniei, precum si director de HR in cadrul unei companii multinationale. El vine acum la Tabara pentru a ne oferi un context de invatare valoros pentru noi. Mai multe detalii despre Alexandru Moldovan pe profilul lui de LinkedIn si pe Twitter

Mai jos sunt detaliile evenimentului:

What does this button do?

Alexandru Moldovan

Sunt situații în care parcă nu contează cât de răbdători suntem în general sau cât de ”evoluați” emoțional am devenit: sunt oameni care ne apasă acele ”butoane”!

Iar unii dintre ei, uneori cei mai apropiați nouă, parcă sunt experți în asta. Reușesc cu o singură remarcă sau o privire bine țintită să ne transforme din persoane sensibile și raționale în adevărați maniaci sau cel puțin să ne ”vibreze” o venă la tâmplă.

Deși identificarea sursei acestor butoane e la fel de relevantă, în acest workshop ne vom concentra pe conștientizarea reacției noastre și posibile alternative de răspuns. Vom folosi câteva concepte din ”comunicarea non-violentă” a lui Marshall Rosenberg, cu două aplicații practice la situații reale din viața noastră personală sau profesională.

Va asteptam!

***About TdT

1. Meetup starts at 18:30.

Please show up at 18:15 to ensure a smooth and proper start of the event.

2. Each meetup has the following workflow:

- by the organizers/facilitators: introduction to Tabara de Testare

- by the speaker: speaker background & then the presentation / workshop itself

- each participant is invited to donate 15 lei to cover the expenses for the location (i.e. Cluj Cowork)

- electronic feedback form - available on the meetup message board after the event

3. TdT online presence:

- Blog: http://tabaradetestare.ro/

- Slideshare: http://www.slideshare.net/tabaradetestare

- Twitter: @tabaradetestare

- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Tabara.de.Testare?fref=ts

- Please mention if you do not wish to be photographed or have your picture posted online

Thank you,

TdT Team

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Iasi-235260978.description:
Hello everyone,

Elena and Dolly from TdT Cluj will be in Iasi on the 6th of December. With this occasion, they will host this meetup. 

Here's what you will learn:


Application tours are very useful in testing, but not many try them out. They definitely should be on your “to learn” list. We propose you a workshop with hands-on touring exercises. You will learn a few possible tours and try them out by yourselves. Then, we’ll do a debrief to discuss what you’ve learned, what the challenges are and how you can apply it in your projects.

You will learn how to do an application tour, which is a handy testing technique. Remember, tours are testing in learning mode, so you will be testing to learn.

What you will need:

Please bring a laptop or any device with Slack installed on it and an open mind :)

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.description:
Salutare, 

Iata ce ne-au pregatit gazdele noastre de la Softvision:

In prima parte o sa vedem un demo despre "Security testing using Fiddler and other security issues" 

1.Security Testing using Fiddler and other security issues
1.1 What is Fiddler, brief introduction
1.2 Useful features of Fiddler for security testing : Filter, Breakpoints, Reissue Request, Compose, Auto Respond
1.3 Real life examples of security risks exposed by using Fiddler :
Reissue request causing issues with double entries.
How Breakpoint expose server issues.
Auto respond to verify you app in case of bad responses.
1.4 Fiddler, Other features like performance measurement
1.5 Basic SQL injection.
1.6 Basic XSS injection.
1.7 Other approaches for a solid and secure app

Apoi, trei tracku-ri in paralel, astfel incat puteti alege ce va intereseaza mai mult.

Open Corners: 2.First Steps of big date testing
2.1 Characteristics of Big Data
2.2 Testing Methods
2.3 Tools
3.Juggling automation and manual testing in everyday life
3.1. Employee, Employer & Client Expectations
3.2. Our Constraints
3.3. Great Decisions
4.Managing Outsourced QA Teams
4.1 Listen, Ask, Propose and React - Earning customer's trust
4.2 Consultancy mindset - a different QA attribute
4.3 Mission impossible or how we are delivering the edge cases

Fiind editie aniversara, mai avem si alte surprize :)

Va asteptam cu drag!

===========================================

Mai jos e lista cu propunerile pe urmatorul an:

- Training SQL - Nivel Mediu (recapitulare nivel Basic, la inceput)

- Time and Risk Management

- Comunicare - colegi, dev/tester

* Biblioteca cu informatii utile:

- certificari, carti, linkuri (recomandare: http://testhuddle.com/)

- Technical movie nights: Pluralsight, Coursera

- UFT (QTP), Selenium WebDriver, TFS, SoapUI (basic training)

* Co-interesare: traininguri, conferinte, certificari

- Prezentari si workshop-uri "Eu am mai facut si vreau sa ajut"

- Prezentation Skills (Moderator Surpriza)

- .Net, Java, Html, CSS, Notiuni de OOP, etc - Basic -> Intermediate

- Prezentari cu traineri certificati

- Add fun stuff

- Database performance testing

- implementarea unor design patterns in testarea automata (in afara de Page Objects)

- Cum tot mai multi lucreaza in Agile, poate ar fi interesanta prezentarea unui mediu de continuos integration (principii, cum se lucreaza cu el si ce se poate face) din perspectiva testarii. - Done - la editia aniversara de 3 ani.

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
Hi,

I invite you all to celebrate with us the start of the winter holidays.

This edition we have one talk and two speakers.

Automated Pipelines with Jenkins, Ansible and Docker in the Cloud. A Case Study 


Alexandru Pătrănescu, Architect and Dragoș Șuțu, Developer at PayU Group Technology Center will present how you can use Ansible, Jenkins, Docker and Docker Swarm to provision a complex system for Continuous Integration in the Cloud.

Alex will talk about the journey they've taken from having a wild local development environment to a standard solution, then a cloud-ready CI environment.

Dragoș will show the magic in a Hands-on Demo.

Agenda:


18:45 - 19:00 Arriving, socializing
19:00 - 19:10 Introduction
19:10 - 20:10 Automated Pipelines with Jenkins, Ansible and Docker in the Cloud. A Case Study
20:10 - 20:20 Break
20:20 - 21:10 Open Space - ask the speakers for more details or propose interesting topics
21:10 - 21:20 Retrospective & Closing

See you on December 7th!

Check out the community <a>vimeo</a> channel for talks we had in previous events. Enjoy!

meetup-The-Iasi-Agile-Software-Meetup-Gr.description:
Are you disappointed or frustrated by the results of your Agile approach?


Have you put in place the roles, artifacts, practices and rituals and you did not realised the promised benefits? If so, you're not alone.


This is a classic problem, due to textbook Agile implementations that are rigid, mechanical, and driven by so-called "best practices" 

Join us to discuss about what it means to be agile. We will examine the most often overlooked, subjective, personal, and intangible pieces that are often missing from effective agile implementations.


Speaker: Ionut Grecu

meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.description:
Timisoara Mobile Development Group and the local Google Developer Group are jointly inviting city's tech passionates to an event that will close the year in force!

We will focus on Firebase, the 15 tools kit supporting serverless architecture and significantly faster mobile (both iOS & Android) and web development.

We'll get the community together for a less practiced event format: participants will experience a guided, hands-on coding experience crafted by Googlers for developers. Some communities run it with a talk. A speaker introducing Firebase tools (TBC) will followed with a 45-60 minutes codelab session, so make sure you'll bring your laptops!

Participants will receive swag offered by Google Firebase and will enter a (CEE regional) contest for winning a free ticket to Google I/O 2017! 

We are charging a small participation fee you may pay from your card or PayPal acount via Meetup.com in order to organize for catering.

If you will not be in Timisoara for that day, check on this map, maybe you can attend another Firebase event.

Looking forward to share the Christmas tech magic with you!

Radu Ticiu & Silviu Vert
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.title: TiMo & GDG Christmas Firebase Codelab
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.venue: Timișoara Startup Hub: 10th, C. Brediceanu St., E Building, Timisoara, Timisoara

meetup-Timisoara-Java-User-Group-2359245.description:
Hello, everyone!


TM-JUG and our friends from Crossover invite you to a (slightly) informal TM-JUG meeting, where I will present an introduction to some of the most useful features from Java 8 (streams, functional programming and Optional objects), followed by a workshop on them.

You can also bring your legacy projects, so that we can 'Java 8 enhance' them; we'll lambda-ify the code, stream-ify the collections and Optional-ize the (potential) NPEs :)


The workshop will be held on the 15th of December, in the 'Atena' hall from Hotel Timisoara, starting from 18:30.


Prerequisites:

• laptop with JDK 8 pre-installed;

• IDE - IntelliJ IDEA, Ultimate edition (preferably); we'll discuss more about the 'whys' in the workshop.

Have a great week!
meetup-Timisoara-Java-User-Group-2359245.title: The 27th TM-JUG meeting - Java 8 intro and workshop

meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.description:
Agenda:

• Serverless computing - How to fire your Sysadmin and and run your code in a scalable and secure environment - Silviu Niculita (Head of Technology - Yonder)


The future of cloud is serverless computing. All of the major cloud providers are going all-in on this new “serverless" paradigm. Amazon Web Service’s Lambda, Google’s Cloud Functions, IBM’s OpenWhisk, and now Azure’s Functions. This session will cover the basic principles of implementing serverless architectures and zoom into Microsoft's offering in this space

• Develop automation solutions for infrastructure provisioning in Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS and VMware vSphere with Live Demo
meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.title: IaaS - Infrastructure provisioning in the cloud
meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.venue: HPE The Office, 5th floor (C & D): Bulevardul 21 Decembrie 1989, Nr 77, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-angularjs-cluj-235644519.description:
At this meetup we invite everyone to come and share their experience in building a startup. 


We welcome all startup owners to come and present the idea behind their startup with a focus on the core technologies used in developing their system since we are at the Fullstack meetup. :)

The format is as always an open discussion where everyone can contribute and share their thoughts freely.

The current startups are:

• CleverWash


• Microhub


• Pașii Mei


• Littledata.io


• iBenefits.ro


If you have a startup that you want to present just add a comment to this meetup and we will add it in the list.
meetup-angularjs-cluj-235644519.title: Building a startup
